Section.Text: The importer of a meat product who has been given a notice for the removal of the meat product from Canada referred to in subsection 18(1) of the Act shall present the meat product to an inspector for verification of the removal of the meat product at the time and place of its removal.
In this Part,

Definition.Text: designated paid holiday means a day specified in article M-20 of the Agreement between the Treasury Board and the Public Service Alliance of Canada — Master Agreement — (PSAC) 300; (jour férié désigné payé)
import shipment means a shipment of meat products covered by an official meat inspection certificate for the purpose of importing the meat products into Canada; (expédition liée à l’importation)
inspection station means a place designated by the Director; (poste d’inspection)
scheduled work shift means a work shift that is agreed to by the President and an operator and that,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a slaughter shift, does not exceed 7.5 hours per inspection station in one day and 37.5 hours per inspection station in one work week, excluding meal times, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a work shift other than a slaughter shift,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: does not exceed 7.5 hours in one day and 37.5 hours in one work week, excluding meal times, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is scheduled between 6:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m.; (période de travail établie)

Definition.Text: slaughter shift means a work shift during which the ante-mortem inspection and slaughter of animals and the post-mortem inspection of carcasses is carried out; (période de travail sur la chaîne d’abattage)

Section.Text: Inspection of a registered establishment and the animals and meat products in it may be carried out outside a scheduled work shift or on a designated paid holiday, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operator of the registered establishment submits a written request to the Executive Director, in a form approved by the Agency; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector is available to carry out the inspection.

Subsection.Text: The Director shall, in respect of an establishment registered for the processing or packaging and labelling of meat products, determine the minimum number of hours of inspection that is required per year for each scheduled work shift, by considering the following criteria:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whether any of the following processes are being performed in the registered establishment and, if so, the number, type and combination of them:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cutting, boning, slicing and comminuting,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: cooking and smoking,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: thermal processing,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: preparation of dry and semi-dry fermented products,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: preparation of dehydrated products,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: handling of ready-to-eat products,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: curing,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: use of bulk nitrate and nitrite salts,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: rendering,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: mechanical deboning,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: offal preparation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: tripe and casing preparation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the level of integration of the activities set out in paragraph (a) with the other activities performed in the registered establishment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the physical size of the registered establishment, the layout of equipment and the type of equipment and technology used;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the mix of products and the volume of production;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: work scheduling practices in the registered establishment; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: where available, the inspection records of the registered establishment and of comparable registered establishments.

Subsection.Text: The Director shall, in respect of an establishment registered for the slaughter of food animals, determine the number of inspection stations that is required per year within a scheduled work shift, by considering the following criteria:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the animal species slaughtered;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the method of carcass inspection used;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the speed of the slaughter line; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the volume of production.

Subsection.Text: The Director may, in respect of an establishment registered for the slaughter of food animals, provide on an annual basis one or more additional inspection stations within a scheduled work shift, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operator of the registered establishment submits a written request to the Director, in a form provided by the Agency; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector is available to provide the service.

Subsection.Text: The Executive Director may, in respect of an establishment registered for the slaughter of food animals, provide on an hourly basis one or more additional inspection stations within a scheduled work shift, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operator of the registered establishment submits a written request to the Executive Director, in a form provided by the Agency; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector is available to provide the service.

Subsection.Text: The operator of a registered establishment shall notify the Director in writing if either of the following situations occurs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is a change in the operations of the registered establishment in respect of any of the criteria set out in subsection (1) or (2); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an additional inspection station provided in accordance with subsection (3) is no longer required.

Subsection.Text: Where the Director is notified of a situation in accordance with subsection (5) or where the Director has other information that a situation referred to in that subsection has occurred, the Director shall re-determine the minimum number of hours of inspection required or the number of inspection stations required, as the case may be.
No person shall remove or alter an official seal or official tag applied by or under the authority of an inspector unless authorized to do so by an inspector.
Any food animal, meat product or other thing being held on the instructions of an inspector shall not be handled or used in any way without the permission of an inspector.

An operator or an importer shall, at the request of an inspector and without charge, provide the inspector, for laboratory examination, with samples of a meat product or any ingredient or additive used or to be used in the preparation of a meat product or any other material used or to be used in connection with a meat product.
Reports on the results of a laboratory examination referred to in subsection (1) shall be made available, on request, to the operator or importer who provided the sample.

Where, in the course of the inspection of a meat product or any ingredient or additive referred to in subsection 131(1), a laboratory examination is conducted on the meat product, the applicable official method registered with the Director shall be used.
The Director shall provide any person, on request, with a copy of an official method referred to in subsection (1).

Section.Text: Where an inspector seizes and detains a meat product or other thing pursuant to section 15 of the Act, the inspector shall attach a detention tag to that meat product or other thing in a prominent place.
An inspector shall, after detaining a meat product or other thing in accordance with section 133, forthwith deliver or mail a notice of detention

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to the person having the care or custody of the meat product or other thing at the place where it was seized and to the person having the care or custody of the meat product or other thing at the place where it is being detained;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to the owner of the meat product or other thing that was seized or to the owner’s agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where a detained meat product or other thing is removed from the place where it was seized to another place in accordance with subsection 14(2) or 15(2) of the Act, to the person having the care or custody of the meat product or other thing at that other place.

Subsection.Text: A meat product or other thing seized and detained under section 15 of the Act shall be detained, at the owner’s expense, under storage conditions appropriate to the preservation of the meat product or other thing.

For the purposes of paragraph 16(1)(a) of the Act, an inspector may require that a meat product or other thing seized and detained under section 15 of the Act be presented for inspection in a registered establishment, within the time period specified therefor in the notice of detention, in order to determine whether the provisions of the Act and these Regulations have been complied with.

Section.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 16(1)(b) of the Act, the longer period after which any meat product or other thing shall not be detained is 180 days.

Where an inspector determines that a detained meat product or other thing conforms to the requirements of the Act and these Regulations, the inspector shall release the meat product or other thing and shall deliver or mail one copy of a notice of release to each of the persons to whom a copy of the notice of detention referred to in section 134 was delivered or mailed.

Definition.Text: anti-foaming agent means a substance authorized by the Food and Drug Regulations to be used in or on a meat product to suppress or prevent the formation of foam; (agent antimousse)
fresh means, in respect of a meat product ingredient, not cooked or preserved; (frais)
preservative means, in respect of a meat product, a preservative authorized by the Food and Drug Regulations to be used in or on the meat product. (agent de conservation)

Provision.Text: For the purposes of this Schedule,

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: unless otherwise specified, any meat product ingredient set out in Column II of an item of this Schedule may be fresh, preserved or cooked;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: unless otherwise specified, the amounts set out in Column V of an item of this Schedule represent percentages in the finished product;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: where two or more names of meat products set out in Column I of an item of this Schedule are combined and used as the name of another meat product, that meat product shall meet the standards applicable in respect of all of the meat products in that name;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: where an optional treatment or process is employed that is not commonly used for a particular meat product set out in Column I of an item of this Schedule, that treatment or process shall be reflected in the name of the meat product;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: headmeat used in the production of headcheese and brawns may include pork scalps and snouts;

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: where pork skin is used as an ingredient in a prepared meat product and there are adhering to it the underlying tissues normally accompanying pork skin and having an average thickness of not less than 1.25 cm, pork skin is considered pork meat;

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: where comminuted boneless pork is used as an ingredient of a prepared meat product, naturally adhering skin is considered pork meat;

Provision.Label: (h)
Provision.Text: where pork skin is separated from muscle tissue, the skin may be added to skinless pork, provided the amount of skin in the pork does not exceed 8 per cent;

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: where boneless poultry is used as an ingredient of a prepared meat product, naturally adhering skin and fat are considered poultry meat;

Provision.Label: (j)
Provision.Text: where poultry skin is separated from muscle tissue, the skin may be added to skinless poultry, provided the amount of skin in the poultry does not exceed 8 per cent.

Provision.Label: (k)
Provision.Text: where poultry fat is separated from the muscle tissue, poultry fat not exceeding four per cent of boneless poultry weight may be added;

Provision.Label: (l)
Provision.Text: where the addition of a filler to a meat product is permitted in Column III of an item of this Schedule, the addition of a seasoning, a spice, a sweetening agent, a flavour enhancer, salt and water is also permitted;

Provision.Label: (m)
Provision.Text: where the addition of water to a meat product is permitted in Column III of an item of this Schedule, the addition of ice and meat broth is also permitted;

Provision.Label: (n)
Provision.Text: where the addition of gravy to a meat product is permitted in Column II of an item of this Schedule or the addition of sauce to a meat product is permitted in Column III of an item of this Schedule, the addition of water and seasoning is also permitted;

Provision.Label: (o)
Provision.Text: where the addition of seasoning to a meat product is permitted in Column III of this Schedule, the addition of salt and spice is also permitted;

Provision.Label: (p)
Provision.Text: where the addition of seasoning to a meat product contributes more than one per cent protein in the finished product, the added seasoning is considered a filler;

Provision.Label: (q)
Provision.Text: where the addition of a preservative to a meat product is permitted in Column III of an item of this Schedule, the addition of alcohol or a sweetening agent or both is also permitted;

Provision.Label: (r)
Provision.Text: where the addition of a filler to a meat product is permitted in Column III of an item of this Schedule, the addition of an ingredient that is not a meat product and does not constitute a filler because it is visually distinguishable from the meat product is also permitted where the name used to describe the resulting product is descriptive of the resulting product.

TableGroup.Caption: PROCESSING AND LABELLING REQUIREMENTS FOR MEAT PRODUCTS

row.entry: Having dry heat applied without direct contact with a flame for a time sufficient to produce the characteristics of a baked or roasted meat product, such as a brown crust on the surface, rendering out-of-surface fat or caramelization of sugar. The meat product must be ready-to-eat.
Cooked with seasoning. The meat product must be ready-to-eat.
Injected with meat broth containing at least 15% solid matter, butter or edible fats or oils that are of vegetable origin, up to a maximum of 3%.
Coated with a combination of batter and bread or cracker crumbs.
Subjected to heat for a time sufficient to produce the characteristics of a cooked meat product in respect of friability, colour, texture and flavour. The meat product must be ready-to-eat.
Dehydrated. The meat product must be ready-to-eat.
Dehydrated by a process of freeze drying.
Gelling agent added at more than 0.25%.

Packaged in a package containing the juices generated by the cooking of the meat product.

Subsection.Text: Unless the context requires otherwise, “trade-mark”, “trade-marks”, “Trade-mark”, “Trade-marks”, “trade mark” and “trade marks”, are replaced by “trademark”, “trademarks”, “Trademark” or “Trademarks”, as the case may be, in the English version of any regulation, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Statutory Instruments Act.

Section.Text: The Meat Inspection Regulations, 199011 are repealed.
